00032 #include <vector>
00033 #include "../common/poptmx.h"
00034 #include "../common/common.h"

00036 #include "../common/experiment.h"

00039 using namespace std;
00040 
00042 struct clargs {
00043   Path command;               
00044   Path listname;                                
00045   bool idealworld;               
00046   string slicedesc;                             
00047   Path outmask;                         
00048   bool beverbose;                               
00049   bool SaveInt;                                 
00050 
00052   clargs(int argc, char *argv[]);
00053 };
00054 
00055 
00056 clargs::
00057 clargs(int argc, char *argv[]) : 
00058   beverbose(false),
00059   SaveInt(false),
00060   idealworld(false),
00061   outmask("sino-<list>-@.tif")
00062 {
00063 
00064   poptmx::OptionTable table
00065         ("Forms absorption-based sinogram(s).",
00066          "Performs following procedures:\n"
00067          "1) reads the text file describing the array of input files"
00068          " (foreground-background pairs).\n"
00069          "2) removes the backgrounds in accordance with this file.\n"
00070          "3) constructs the sinograms of the slices requested in the slice string.");
00071 
00072   table
00073         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "ARGUMENTS:")
00074         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &listname, "list",
00075       "List of the input images.", AqSeries::Desc)
00076         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &outmask, "result mask",
00077                  "Output result mask.", MaskDesc, outmask)
00078 
00079         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "OPTIONS:")
00080         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &slicedesc, 's', "slice",
00081                  "Slices to be processed.", SliceOptionDesc, "<all>")
00082         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &idealworld, 'w', "idealworld",
00083                  "Suppose we live in the ideal world.", IdealWorldOptionDesc)
00084         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &SaveInt,'i', "int",
00085     "Output image(s) as integer.", IntOptionDesc)
00086         .add_standard_options(&beverbose)
00087         .add(poptmx::MAN, "SEE ALSO:", SeeAlsoList);
00088 
00089   if ( ! table.parse(argc,argv) )
00090         exit(0);
00091   if ( ! table.count() ) {
00092         table.usage();
00093         exit(0);
00094   }
00095 
00096   command = table.name();
00097 
00098 
00099   // <list> : one required argument.
00100   if ( ! table.count(&listname) )
00101     exit_on_error(command, "Missing required argument: <list>.");
00102 
00103   // <result mask> : one more argument may or may not exist
00104   if ( ! table.count(&outmask) )
00105         outmask = upgrade(listname, "sino-") + "-@.tif";
00106   if ( string(outmask).find('@') == string::npos )
00107         outmask = outmask.dtitle() + "-@" + outmask.extension();
00108 
00109 }
00110 
00111 
00112 
00114 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00115 
00116   const clargs args(argc, argv);
00117   const AqSeries list(args.listname);
00118   const ABSexp expr(list);
00119   int
00120     thetas=expr.thetas(),
00121     pixels=expr.pixels(),
00122     slices=expr.slices();
00123   const string sliceformat = mask2format(args.outmask, slices);
00124   const vector<int> sliceV = slice_str2vec(args.slicedesc, slices);
00125   const SinoS sins(expr, sliceV, args.beverbose);
00126 
00127   Map sinogram(thetas, pixels);
00128   ProgressBar bar( args.beverbose, "sinograms formation", sliceV.size());
00129 
00130   for (unsigned slice=0 ; slice < sliceV.size() ; slice++ ) {
00131         sins.sino(slice, sinogram);
00132         if ( args.idealworld )  sinogram = cutone(sinogram);
00133         SaveImage( toString(sliceformat, sliceV[slice]+1), sinogram, args.SaveInt);
00134         bar.update();
00135   }
00136 
00137   exit(0);
00138 
00139 }
